sourceMeaningMnemonic: If the <radical>rain</radical> touches your <radical>foot</radical> and gives it a little rain <radical>kiss</radical>, you know that part of your foot is <kanji>expose</kanji>d to the elements. You can also see some <kanji>dew</kanji> forming on your exposed foot. So that's what rain kisses are!
meaningInfo: Ugh, you shouldn't have bought these open toed shoes, at least not during rainy season!
readingMnemonic: You run along the <reading>ro</reading>ad (<ja>ろ</ja>), trying to get out of the rain, but the road keeps going and going, with walls on both sides.
readingInfo: You wonder how long this road will go. With exposed toes, your feet are going to get all wet with dew if you can't get off this blasted road.
